title: Digital Creativity-Based Distance Learning Design and Parental Awareness Improvement Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital tool proficiency and foundational science concepts
context.additional_context: Learners include university students and adolescents working as professionals (medical/legal/technical), participating in blended education combining offline and online instruction with digital devices.

learning_goals: Learners can demonstrate over 80% autonomy in the scientific problem-solving process through digital creativity tasks
Parents/guardians achieve a satisfaction score of 3.5 or higher on a 4-point Likert scale regarding school support after participating in web conference classes
Learners can reduce learning difficulties by 30% compared to traditional methods when combining offline tactile activities with digital creativity tasks

resources: Digital Creation Tools (3D Modeling, Virtual Lab Kits)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
